sentences: Apollo 11 was the first <<||>> that landed humans on the Moon. Mission <<||>> Neil Armstrong and pilot Buzz Aldrin landed the <<||>> module Eagle on July 20, 1969. Armstrong became the first to step onto the lunar <<||>> six hours later on July 21; Aldrin <<||>> about 20 minutes later. They spent about two and a quarter hours together outside the <<||>>, and collected 47.5 <<||>> of lunar material for return to Earth. Michael Collins <<||>> the command module Columbia alone in lunar <<||>> while they were on the Moon's surface. Armstrong and Aldrin spent just under a day on the lunar surface before <<||>> with Columbia in lunar orbit. Launched by a Saturn V <<||>> from Kennedy Space Center in Merritt Island, Florida, on July 16, Apollo 11 was the fifth <<||>> of NASA's Apollo program. <<||>> on live TV to a world-wide audience, Armstrong stepped onto the lunar surface and <<||>> the event as 'one small step for man, one giant <<||>> for [a] mankind.' Apollo 11 effectively ended the <<||>> and fulfilled a national goal proposed in 1961 by US President John F. Kennedy: 'before this decade <<||>>, of landing a man on the Moon and returning him safely to <<||>>.' Via wikipedia.org
